pull.title: Push cs_main locks down in ProcessBlock
pull.body: For now, built on top of #3884.

events.body: Rebased and added an interruption point in ActivateBestChain, as suggested by @laanwj.

ACK on code changes
Also I've run with this patch for about a week now on my node. No problems.
I'm running this patch together with #2784, #4100 and #4177, and I'm seeing occasional segfaults. I believe this patch is the most likely cause, so I'll investigate first.

initial review ACK (untested).

I will try some lock-debug testing later this week.
I haven't seen any segfaults anymore since running on top of #4204.
I still haven't had any segfaults running with this.

events.message: Get rid of the static chainMostWork (optimization)
Allow ActivateBestChain to release its lock on cs_main
Move all post-chaintip-change notifications to ActivateBestChain

events.body:

Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

issue.title: Initialization reports "Loading banlist..." while doing something else
issue.body:
While starting up a node (commit 6fc6325), it was apparently taking curiously long to load the ban list. RPC (in warmup mode) kept returning `Loading banlist...`. When I checked the log I happened upon the following:

```
2016-05-30 07:35:00 init message: Loading banlist...
2016-05-30 07:35:26 UpdateTip: new best=0000000000000000045614e4901f822a86e4015543acc6a68653cc9450f0f330 height=410222 version=0x20000000 log2_work=84.600836 tx=126776938 date='2016-05-04 18:0
1:59' progress=0.984518 cache=8.8MiB(5488tx)
...
2016-05-30 07:39:43 DNS seeding disabled
2016-05-30 07:39:43 opencon thread start
2016-05-30 07:39:43 msghand thread start
2016-05-30 07:39:43 addcon thread start
2016-05-30 07:39:43 init message: Done loading
2016-05-30 07:39:43 net thread start
```

I think it's a matter of the init message not being updated for a new initialization phase after loading the banlist.

comments.body: Isn't chainActive here and a few lines below accessed without cs_main?

Nice catch. However, chainActive should never be modified anywhere but in the thread calling this method (the message handler), so it can't be the cause for the segfault i observed (perhaps #4204 fixed it, though). I'll fix it.
